subject: Technology
title: The Light Bulb: Who Really Invented It?
description: A 60-second lesson on The Light Bulb: Who Really Invented It?.

hook.text: Edison didn't invent the light bulb. At least 20 inventors created working light bulbs before him.

buildup.text: Humphry Davy demonstrated electric light in 1802. Others built bulbs that worked but burned out in minutes.

discovery.text: Edison's real achievement was finding a filament that lasted over 1,000 hours, making the bulb practical.

twist.text: He also built the power grid, meters, and sockets needed to deliver electricity to homes. The bulb was just the beginning.

climax.text: Edison created not just a product but an entire system. That's why he gets the credit.

punchline.text: Edison didn't invent light. He invented the system to sell it.

quiz.question: What was Edison's real contribution to the light bulb?
options: He made a durable filament and built the delivery system
